alert.note: Alert for Okaloosa (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 15 at 6:52PM EDT until June 15 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mobile has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northern Okaloosa County in northwestern Florida... * Until 900 PM CDT. * At 552 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 1 to 3 inches in 1 hour. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Training storms over the town of Crestview will likely lead to rapid flooding of low lying poor drainage areas in and around Crestview. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Crestview, Baker, Silver Springs, Milligan, Auburn, Garden City, Clear Springs, Nubbin Ridge, Cannon Town, Campton, Galliver, Killingsworth Crossroads, Deerland, Holt, Dorcas and Kellys Mill. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1-3 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
